description: deaf +‎ -en (verbal suffix), compare Middle English deven, deaven (“to make deaf”), Old English ādēafian (“to deafen”), Dutch verdoven (“to stupefy, deafen”), German betäuben (“to stun, stupefy, deafen”).

verbs.description: deafen (third-person singular simple present deafens, present participle deafening, simple past and past participle deafened)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make deaf, either temporarily or permanently.

examples: to deafen a wall or a floor

entries.meaning: (transitive, rare, dialectal, sometimes figurative) To stun, as with noise.
examples: Racine left the ground  […]  deafened, dazzled and tired to death.
